info.title: OPERA Cloud Front Desk Configuration API
info.description:
APIs to cater for Front Desk Configuration in OPERA Cloud. Here you can find operations to get, post, put and delete front desk codes such as commission codes, transaction groups, codes & subgroups, articles, payment methods and credit card types.

Compatible with OPERA Cloud release 25.1.0.0.

This document and all content within is available under the Universal Permissive License v 1.0 (https://oss.oracle.com/licenses/upl). Copyright (c) 2020, 2025 Oracle and/or its affiliates.

get.description:
Use this API to return articles for one or multiple properties based on search criteria such as hotelIds, transactionCodes, articleCodes, etc. One transaction code can sometimes serve as an umbrella for multiple articles, which can be posted using that transaction code. For example, a single mini bar food transaction code might cover potato chips, crackers, peanuts, pretzels, and so on.

OperationId:getArticles

parameters.name: universalProductCode
parameters.description: Unique Universal product code search criteria.

parameters.name: includeInactive
parameters.description: Indicator that tells whether to include inactive articles in search results.

200.description: Response for fetching articles.

delete.description:
Operation to remove articles.

OperationId:deleteArticles

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Used for codes in the OPERA Code tables. Possible values of this pattern are 1, 101, 101.EQP, or 101.EQP.X.

parameters.name: articleCodes
parameters.description: Unique code of the article.

parameters.name: articleHotelId
parameters.description: Hotel code to which the article belongs.

parameters.name: inactive
parameters.description: Indicates whether the article is inactive or not.

parameters.name: orderSequence
parameters.description: Display Order sequence.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the article.

parameters.name: transactionCode
parameters.description: Transaction code to which the article belongs.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: A monetary amount.

parameters.name: currencyCode
parameters.description: Provides a currency code to reflect the currency in which an amount may be expressed.

parameters.name: availableForPostIt
parameters.description: Indicates whether the article is available for post it.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Color configuration type. This color configuration provides a visual category of entities.

parameters.name: universalProductCode
parameters.description: Unique Universal product code of the article.

200.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

parameters.description: Numberic code for cashier ID.

parameters.description: Indicates maximum number of records a Web Service should return.

parameters.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Partial name of a cashier.

parameters.name: includeInactive
parameters.description: Indicator that tells whether to include inactive cashiers in search results.

parameters.description: Name of the application user associated with the cashier id

uniqueID_Type.description: An identifier used to uniquely reference an object in a system (e.g. an airline reservation reference, customer profile reference, booking confirmation number, or a reference to a previous availability quote).

instanceLink.description: Metadata describing link description objects that MAY appear in the JSON instance representation.

href.description: URI [RFC3986] or URI Template [RFC6570]. If the value is set to URI Template, then the "templated" property must be set to true.

rel.description: Name of the link relation that, in addition to the type property, can be used to retrieve link details. For example, href or profile.

templated.description: Boolean flag that specifies that "href" property is a URI or URI Template. If the property is a URI template, set this value to true. By default, this value is false.

method.description: HTTP method for requesting the target of the link.

warningsType.description: Used in conjunction with the Success element to define a business error.

warningType.description: Used when a message has been successfully processed to report any warnings or business errors that occurred.

shortText.description: An abbreviated version of the error in textual format.

code.description: If present, this refers to a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings.

docURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the ErrorRS, (NotProcessed Incomplete Complete Unknown) however, the data type is designated as string data, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

tag.description: If present, this attribute may identify an unknown or misspelled tag that caused an error in processing. It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].

recordId.description: If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.

type.description: The Warning element MUST contain the Type attribute that uses a recommended set of values to indicate the warning type. The validating XSD can expect to accept values that it has NOT been explicitly coded for and process them by using Type ="Unknown".

rph.description: Reference Place Holder used as an index for this warning.

codeType.description: The rule type on which the Transaction Discount is based.

amount.description: The amount applicable to the transaction discount.This would be a positive amount indicating the discount.

percent.description: A percentage value if the transaction discount is percentage based.

inactive.description: Indicates whether the transaction discount is inactive or not.

discountAttributes.description: Holds Transaction Discounts Attributes details.If discount is applied to a membership type, only membership type details are required. If discount is applied on a membership level , membership type and membership level details are required.

transactionCodes.description: Collection of transaction codes eligible for transaction discounts.

transactionDiscountTypeValue.description: Holds the value of transaction discount type. e.g the value of the membership type can be given when transactionDiscountType is set to MembershipType

transactionDiscountCodeType.description: The code type on which the transaction discount is based.

membershipTypes.description: List of the Membership Types of Vouchers Config to be copied.

type.description: Posting rhythm types for custom charges.

startOnNight.description: Starting night of the reservation for which the custom charge will be posted. This is applicable when the posting rhythm 'Post On Every X Nights Starting Y Night' is selected.

postEveryXNights.description: The custom charge will be posted for every X night, where X is the frequency of nights. This is applicable when the posting rhythm 'Post On Every X Nights Starting Y Night' is selected.

startOnNightPrice.description: The amount for which the custom charge will be posted to the reservation, starting on the night defined by 'Start On Night'. This is applicable when the posting rhythm 'Post On Every X Nights Starting Y Night' is selected.

maxNights.description: The maximum number of nights for which the custom charge posted to the reservation. This is applicable when the posting rhythm 'Post Every Night For X Nights' is selected.

customChargePostingRhythmTypeOption.description: Defined values for posting rhythm LOV.

customChargeRangeType.description: The lower and upper range value for which the corresponding price is posted as a custom charge.

rangeFrom.description: The lower range value for which the corresponding price is posted as a custom charge.

rangeTo.description: The upper range value for which the corresponding price is posted as a custom charge.

price.description: The price of the custom charge, for the given range.

folioCodeDescriptionType.description: This contains a folio code and description information.

managedByOptions.description: Describes of the Configuration is Managed by Enterprise or Property.

roomTypeBasedChargeRngs.description: Defines Room Type Based Charge Range response type.

transactionNo.description: Transaction number, Unique Identifier of the record.

generateTrxCode.description: Generate of the Main Transaction code.
